comments.body: Sorry not sure what the above sentence is trying to say.
not sure how to rephrase, basically 'last defined' or 'last loaded' overwrites existing

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +15,19 @@Precedence categories
---------------------

Ansible supports four sources for controlling its behavior. In order of precedence from lowest (most easily overridden) to highest (overrides all others), the categories are:

comments.body: Consider flipping this on its head.  When I think "highest", I naturally expect to see it at the top of this bullet list. That might jus be my mental quirk so take w/ a grain o salt.

My instinct is the same, but I vote we save that for a future PR. If we flip this list, we also need to flip the [precedence-among-variables list](https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/user_guide/playbooks_variables.html#ansible-variable-precedence), and this PR has enough scope creep already.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +22,26 @@ * Playbook keywords
 * Variables

Each category overrides any information from all lower-precedence categories. For example, a playbook keyword will override any configuration setting.
